subject: RE: [junit] Newbie - Kindly help
msgSnippet: Anand, You should take a look at http://httpunit.sourceforge.net. It will provide you with a library of classes that you can call with-in the Junit framework.
messageBody:
Anand,

You should take a look at http://httpunit.sourceforge.net It will provide
you with a library of classes that you can call with-in the Junit framework.
We have been using is on our web apps with a great deal of success. Search
the mailing list
http://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/httpunit-develop for some good
pointers on how to use it in a testing scenario.

Good luck,

John

-----Original Message-----
From: anand_73@... [mailto:anand_73@...]
Sent: Thursday, August 23, 2001 11:13 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Newbie - Kindly help


Hi

How does one test the functionality of Web-sites,like Submit buttons ?
When I do a submit,I want to make sure that the next page is
displayed correctly.

Kindly suggest me the tool/methodology

Thanks
Anand
